paper.title: A Syntax for Linear Logic
paper.venue: International Conference on Mathematical Foundations of Programming Semantics
paper.abstract: There is a standard syntax for Girardu0027s linear logic, due to Abramsky, and a standard semantics, due to Seely. Alas, the former is incoherent with the latter: different derivations of the same syntax may be assigned different semantics. This paper reviews the standard syntax and semantics, and discusses the problem that arises and a standard approach to its solution. A new solution is proposed, based on ideas taken from Girardu0027s Logic of Unity. The new syntax is based on pattern matching, allowing for concise expression of programs.
